workflow.name: Track OpenAI token usage and AI agent metrics with Google Sheets dashboard
workflow.description:
**What it does**
Captures token usage and cost from your AI Agent/LLM. Logs model, tokens, cost, tool use, and conversation I/O to Google Sheets for simple observability and billing.

**Perfect for**
Developers adding usage monitoring to AI agents.
Teams needing cost transparency in prototypes.

**How it works**

1. Chat Trigger collects user input for the AI Agent.
2. A Set node injects metadata like workflow, execution, and client IDs.
3. LangChain Code node returns a configured Chat model with a callback that reads usage metadata.
4. The callback computes input, output, and total costs based on per‚Äëmillion token prices you define.
5. It appends token metrics to a Google Sheet via the Google Sheets Tool.
6. The Agent records intermediate tool calls.
7. An If node checks whether a tool was used.
8. When tools are used, the workflow logs input, output, tool name, and metadata to an Observability sheet.

**How to use**
SELF-HOSTED N8N ONLY - the Langchain Code node is only available in the self-hosted version of n8n. It is not available in n8n cloud.

**Requirements**
Self-hosted version of n8n


**If you have any questions in running the workflow, see the attached video:** https://youtu.be/JSulRS128MA

workflow.name: Track LLM Token Usage and Agent Observability on Google Sheets

parameters.initialMessages:
Welcome to Troopers!

So glad you‚Äôre here! üòä Are you already a Troopers client, or just getting started?

parameters.content:
## Start here: Step-by Step Youtube Tutorial :star:
For model-specific tweaks to the LangChain Code node, follow your provider‚Äôs LangChain setup. For a walkthrough, see the attached video:

[![Building an AI Personal Assistant](https://img.youtube.com/vi/JSulRS128MA/sddefault.jpg)](https://youtu.be/JSulRS128MA)

**Start here (required settings)**

* In **Set ‚Ä¢ Workflow + Client Metadata**, set `client_id`. Keep `workflow_id` and `execution_id` as is.
* In **LangChain Chat Model + Token Callback**, set `model`, `input_token_cost`, `output_token_cost`.
* Ensure `OPENAI_API_KEY` or your provider key is set as an environment variable.
* In **Token Usage Log**, select your Spreadsheet and the Metrics sheet. **Replace with‚Ä¶** Sheet ID and Sheet name.
* In **Log ‚Ä¢ Token Metrics to Sheets (Tool)**, select your Spreadsheet and the Observability sheet. **Replace with‚Ä¶** Sheet ID and Sheet name.
* Add **Google Sheets OAuth2** credentials.


**What this workflow does**

* Receives a chat message and runs an AI Agent.
* Tracks tokens and computes costs in a LangChain callback.
* Logs token metrics to a Metrics sheet.
* Logs input, output, and tool usage to an Observability sheet.
* Associates each row with workflow, execution, and client IDs.


**Customize**

* Change `model` and token prices to match your provider‚Äôs pricing.
* Add more metadata fields in **Set metadata** as needed.
* Extend the callback to include latency or provider request IDs.
* Add a Limit or Sample node for high-volume runs.
* Swap the Chat Trigger for Webhook Trigger if you do not need the built-in chat.

user.name: Hunyao
user.bio:
Hun Yao is a founder-engineer obsessed with building scalable automation that actually moves the needle - with a focus in the E-commerce space. 

A self-taught product builder with roots in marketing and AI, he uses n8n as his playground to ship MVPs fast - turning modular workflows into elegant, revenue-generating systems.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
